SENT.plain: Adenocarcinoma arising in ectopic gastric mucosa has been reported more than 40 years ago
This report reviews our experience with Barrett's adenocarcinoma over 8 years
The definition remains subject to controversy
More than 50% of patients in our study had unfavorable course of disease
The hope for cure lies almost in early detection of tumors at which point a truly curative resection could be done
There is no difference in terms of survival comparing to the adenocarcinoma arising on normal esophagus
